title: Drawing, 1938-88-135
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
inscribed:
Lower left: Tempio del Ingratitudine 
Numbered at upper right
On plinth of tomb: PUTTO [?] A ME/ E DOVUTO

On lunettes above the tomb: 
Left: PER RENDERSI/ PIU DEGNI/ INGRATI CON IL PAPA
Center: CHI/ E/ PIU INGRATO/ QUA SI ONORA
Right: PER RENDERSI/ BEN DEGNI/ INGRATI/ CON LA MADRE/ E CON CHI LE/ FA BENE

In surrounding lunettes:
Left: E UN/ DOVERE/ INTOLERA/ N[?]ZZA
Left center: AMORE/ MAI PER/ ALCUNO/ ODIO SEM[P]RE
Right center: IL DOVERE/ E DI FAR/ MORIRE CHI/ LEVA LA FAME
Right: LA VEN [cut off]/ N/ ANNO L [cut off]/ PRIME P [cut off]/ IN QUEST [cut off]
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Horizontal rectangle: circular subterranean vaulted hall, huge supporting column in the middle in the centre of which a kind of altar with temple statue lying on it.
